title: Cane River Creole National Historical Park: Park Home
body: A River and Its People  The Cane River region is home to a unique culture; the Creoles. The nearly three hundred year relationship between the Cane River Creoles and their homeland was shaped by the river. This relationship was tested by flood, drought, war, and numerous other obstacles. Luckily, their resilience and resourcefulness has allowed the Creole culture to endure and thrive.              A precious view   The morning sun highlights the oak alley and the flowers in the bottle garden.
